JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Dean Spielmann;Elisabeth Steiner;George Nicolaou;Khanlar Hajiyev;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE . The applicant was represented by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by PERSON GPE , former Representative of GPE at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant , a former military officer , lives in a municipal flat . In DATE he asked the NORP housing maintenance authority to transfer to him the title to that flat . His request was rejected because PERSON was a “ restricted military settlement ” and NORP law prohibited the transfer of title to housing LOC in such settlements .
In DATE the applicant unsuccessfully repeated his request .

On DATE the applicant challenged before ORG of ORG decree no . CARDINAL-p by which the town of Monino was included in the list of “ restricted military settlements ” . He claimed that the decree infringed his right to receive title to the flat .
On DATE ORG dismissed the claim , holding , in so far as relevant , as follows :

“ By virtue of section CARDINAL of the Federal Law “ On ORG ” particular status is given to restricted military settlements in order to assign housing premises to military authorities for subsequent distribution of housing premises among military servicemen and other persons connected to the military service ...

The applicant 's arguments that the disputed regulation contradicts LAW and CARDINAL and LAW of LAW [ and ] violates his right to acquire title to the flat where he lives are ill - founded because the contested Government 's regulation sets out the list of restricted military settlements which have housing LOC . The prohibition on transferring the title to housing LOC in restricted military settlements was established by section CARDINAL of the RSFSR Law no . CARDINAL - CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE “ On ORG in the GPE ” ... , other legal acts of GPE and the constituencies of GPE , and not by the contested regulation . ”
The applicant appealed against that judgment . He also sought leave to appear before the appeal court .
On DATE ORG notified the applicant that the appeal hearing was scheduled for TIME on DATE .

On DATE , at TIME , the applicant , accompanied by CARDINAL witnesses , arrived at the courthouse . According to the witnesses ' statements , presented to the ORG by the applicant , a clerk told them that they were third in the queue and instructed them to wait by courtroom no . CARDINAL . They had been waiting for TIME when judges leaving the courtroom for lunch told them that the applicant 's case had already been examined .

ORG upheld the judgment of CARDINAL DATE . It noted that the town of GPE had been included in the list of restricted military settlements in DATE . By regulation no . CARDINAL of DATE the ORG merely confirmed that the town of Monino was a restricted military settlement which included housing LOC . On DATE the Law “ On ORG in the GPE ” ( “ LAW ” ) was adopted . It granted individuals the right to acquire title to ORG and municipal - owned flats of which they had taken possession on the basis of a social tenancy agreement . At the same time , section CARDINAL of that law prohibited the transfer of title to ORG and municipal owned flats to individuals in restricted military settlements . ORG stressed that the applicant should have challenged that legal provision in LAW and not the ORG 's regulation .
